xml:
The floodplains are populated with all kinds of vegetation, which is beneficial for a variety of functions. However, during high flow trees, shrubberies and hedges can offer a lot of resistance to flow.
For this intervention, all vegetation in the green zone is replaced with grass. Grass offers little resistance against flow. This has the potential to lower water levels significantly.
However, it also introduces a lot of uncertainty because it changes a lot about the river, while the effect is relatively low. You will see that other intervention change less of the existing river, but are relatively more effective. Therefore, these alternative interventions are less uncertain.
Disclaimer: please note that the purpose of this study was to find out what the effect of parameter uncertainty is on highly detailed model predictions of flood prevention measures, not to find the best solution for this particular problem.
